website_summaries.verdict: The Bowers & Wilkins P9 Signature is an absolute top-of-the-line headphone pair, with exceptional performance and a sky-high price to match.
pros: Wonderful, balanced, and accurate audio performance with rich bass depth and detailed, clear highs
Comes with three detachable cable options and a luxurious carrying case

customer_reviews.title: Lovely looking headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are very expensive headphones ,but you get what you pay for, build quality is very high and premium materials are used,Sound quality is supurb ,detail retrival are as good as other headphones in my collection, soundstage is confined to within my head but it is a deep almost 3d soundstage ,individual instrements can be clearly placed within the soundscape , base is solid and without being to warm and detailed , midrange is clean ,detailed and clear , treble is smooth and never harsh or sibilant and displays every detail in the music played through these headphones. These are a fun headphone to listen too ,and will have your foot tapping .
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Get better with time
customer_reviews.text: When I got these I was underwhelmed, didn't sound much better than the P7's, but they need a fair bit of time to sound good, I’ve been using them for about 30 hours and now they sound 10X better than the P7's, and I used to think they sounded good, now they sound terrible in comparison, I've read they take at least 50 hours before you get the best from them so things can only get better, still a high price but for me they are worth it
customer_reviews.author: S. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly good sound quality. I'm very fussy as I have electrostatic loudspeakers but in these times of lockdown I wanted great headphones so as not to annoy anyone else. Very comfortable - I'm spending upward of 5 hours a day listening and no issues. Sevenoaks sound and vision dispatched them the same evening that I placed the order and they arrived very soon after. The imaging is much more real than other headphones I have tried (and pretty expensive ones too). It's not "in your head". Like all good audio products they're fussy about what drives them. The better the source the better they sound. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality sound...better than anything l've experienced before...but the again should be good at the price!. Sound reproduction is better than my B&W 607s
customer_reviews.author: Dr C M Holmes

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I ever had.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I ever had. Bowers & Wilkins products are consistently excellent. These are even better. Well done Bowers & Wilkins. Expensive. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: P Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, just not quite perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing, the building quality is second to none but they are heavy. Removing the ear cup to change cables is also a bit of a faff.
customer_reviews.author: Will Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Quality of sound and Comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Finest headset ever owned. Now already my favourite. highs and lows exceptional. Clarity of instrumental sounds superb.
customer_reviews.author: MR D J ISHERWOOD

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, sound quality not as expected for the price.  Closed construction so ears can get hot.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, sound quality not as expected for the price. Closed construction so ears can get hot.
customer_reviews.author: moregifts

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic audiofil sound!!
customer_reviews.text: Best sound ever and the design awsome. Greatest headphones ever owned. High price, but worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Stensgaard

customer_reviews.title: Utterly brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have owned headphones that cost twice as much but they don't come close. These are the bees doodahs. Pricey but so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wade

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I can only say these are the best headphones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: MR M J PAYNE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound excellent pay for p 9 best p7 so so
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customertheraphan jittalarn

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing. It's as if my ears were colorblind and ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible sound. I thought it might have just been a marketing gimmick when they said you will hear things you've never heard before but I can confirm the truth of it. I've been listening to it nonstop since I received my unit and it is absolutely divine. The song I tested was "Nude" by Radiohead and I was able to hear all the smallest details down to the scrape of the pick on the guitar strings. Truly amazing. It's as if my ears were colorblind and now they can see in full color. If you can afford it, it's absolutely worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Chico Guava

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Without a Headphone Amplifier
customer_reviews.text: Regrettable! When plugged directly into a receiver's headphone jack the sound is weak, uninvolving and completely devoid of B&W's claim of a strong deep bottom end (bass). Do not waste your money buying these unless you already have a quality ($500-$2,000) headphone amp or plan to purchase one soon after buying these cans. I have great B&W speakers but can't use them where I currently live. This was the biggest waste of $800+ dollars with tax I have ever made in my life!
customer_reviews.author: William Z. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Wires
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear at work. I was hoping the noise cancellation feature would drown out the co-workers who tend to speak louder than necessary when discussing issues but when I got these out of the box there were too many wires to contend with. I was hoping for a blue tooth type headphone that was much easier to use but this was not it. Very well made but I send them back because the wires were just too much.
customer_reviews.author: David Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Bust for me
customer_reviews.text: Found to be too much bass tinted, colored the overall sound. Good quality other then that. Gave it to the grandson, he's still using it. Pretty much a bust for me, but not for others.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with the sound quality and i just wish it was more comfortable..The headset is relatively heavy but the sound quality, the clarity , bass everything is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These were a Christmas gift to myself. I found I had an adjustment period. I initially thought that they were not much better than my P3 headphones I've had for 4 years. Gradually, I discovered they were light years away from my P3. I recently put my P3s back on after listening to only the P9. I was shocked! My P3 sounded tinny!! The P9 is excellent! I do hear things I had not heard before. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love about these.... When only the best will do.....
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound. Well balanced with slightly increased mid bass
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound. Very expensive. For this price maybe one should upgrade to Sennheiser 800s or Focal Utopia or better?
customer_reviews.author: DrUrsus

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Headphones ever! What I had really hoped for in the P7's after owning P5's for several years. Needless to say a high-end headphone worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound!...
customer_reviews.text: The sound of these things is freek'in awesome! I have a lot of expensive headphones and these are right there at the top of the list. They are crystal clear, dynamic, engaging and smooth. The build and comfort are very impressive. I don't think B&W held anything back. A GREAT product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gene K.

customer_reviews.title: Rediscovered all my music with these headphones! Couldn't be happier..
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! After thousands of dollars spent on Bose headphones over the past 5 years, I feel like I have completely missed out after listening to these incredible headphones. The price is well worth it if you listen to music every day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound... rich in detail and 3d like performace with my out board DAC...simply perfect well balanced sound. Bargain at twice this price.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent K. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and amp is not needed. Well worth the price. Edit 8/2018 - Just got the PX's and wired, the sound is almost as good as the P9's. Don't buy the P9's without listening to the PX's first. My P9's are gathering dust now.
customer_reviews.author: riptide355

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like these headphones but they weren't up to the level of the Sony Z1R.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Windle

customer_reviews.title: More marketing/price them audio quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good headphone but it's more marketing than audio quality. This headphone was design to work with devices like smartphones, small media players, tablets etc but his size specially the headband is huge. The sound...well, the sound is better than P7 but nothing really "so" distant, there are improvements, more bass really deep, more treble, more extension, more flat. The difference of price between P9 and P7 doesn't follow their performances. Well, on my first week using B&W P9 the volume control stopped working, only volume (for now).
customer_reviews.author: iMilazzo

customer_reviews.title: Who said audio engineers of some of the best speakers in the world can design good headphones?
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe owners of these headphones consider them outstanding. The bass overpowers all other frequencies produced by the headphones. They sound incredibly flat, but not in a good way. Dull! Unless you eq them, they are disappointing. The Sennheiser 650's for $300 are a better choice. These are an expensive upgrade from beats. If your into hip hop, these will appeal to you. For the rest of us, seriously, look at something else for the same or less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I can only reiterate what's been stated before. These are the best built headphones I've ever had/seen They do take quite a while to bed in, but it's worth the wait. I use an Acoustic Research player and bought these to replace a pair of Sony MDR-1000X's(which aren't cheap) as I didn't think they were doing the player justice. Am I glad I did. You upgrade and occasionally your head goes 'hold on i haven't heard that before' I was amazed how much was going on in the background of I Don't Want To Go To Chelsea by Elvis Costello. So, they are expensive but they're well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: love them to bits
customer_reviews.text: they are just amazing. I love listening to music with these. I have the P7s, which are also excellent. The P9s are a step up. the sound is more expansive and the tonal quality of instruments is fantastic. There are certain songs (perfect day)that when listening I feel as if i am in the studio listening to the original recording. I haven't reconciled myself with the amount of money they cost.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Stagg

customer_reviews.title: Incredible open sound
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I've ever listened to..I recently owned P7s and these are a step up in quality from those with extra clarity depending on the quality of recordings you are listening to with a more detailed open sound you will hear extra detail in songs that you hadn't heard before Pros: incredible rich sound with excellent bass and clear treble without being harsh Cons: still expensive but a worthy investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. D. Card

customer_reviews.title: Price does not justify the sound
customer_reviews.text: I tried those together with Fostex TH900MK2 and AUDEZE LCD2. While B&W are cheaper £200-300, they are also quite "narrow" regarding a sound stage. Both lows and highs are sounding expanded and quite close to each other while mids are struggling somewhere in between. P9 do have a feel of quite well build and definitely not cheap. But the price tag absolutely does not justify the sound. My personal choice would be Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 (cca. £200) over these cans at any time but than again, it's a matter of personal preference. I would certainly recommend trying Fostex TH900MK2 and AUDEZE LCD2 before buying P9's as £200-300 more will take you to an entirely different universe!
customer_reviews.author: Underground Rat

customer_reviews.title: The nearest thing in headphones to strapping a pair of high end full range speakers to your head
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the P7s for a couple of years now, and it’s been interesting to compare these new P9s to those. Basically, the P9s take everything I like about the P7s, and turn it up to 11. Bass slam, dynamics, detail, are all there but improved. They fix the one thing I didn’t like about the P7s - a hard edge to the midrange that gets a bit fatiguing at high volumes. That’s totally gone. The sound is just slightly bass rich which can make the P9s sound a bit less detailed at first, but then you realize that they’re pulling out detail you haven’t noticed before. If you like the P7s, you’ll love these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in SF

customer_reviews.title: Looks and sounds luxurious
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by these headphones! I was considering the PX but after hearing just how much more clear, rich, and spacious these sounded in comparison I couldn’t go back. I use these headphones with the Audioquest Dragonfly Red, I think it’s a great combo - really does the headphones justice.
customer_reviews.author: Aetoss

customer_reviews.title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!
customer_reviews.text: These IMO are really great headphones. I've used them to mix Tracks "on the go" and The producer, Label and Artist were all Happy with the end Product. Sometimes they perform better than the Genelecs in my studio (depending on the material). Mastering Engineer even Joked that i should dump my speakers and just use these. Theres little to no Ear Fatigue, Doesn't take Long to get used to and once You Trust what you hear you're gonna be OK. They're incredibly Honest. B&W is always Quality
customer_reviews.author: keron Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! I use them when my baby is sleeping. I run them from my Mcintosh C2600 and I think they do an excellent job in capturing mid ranges, exhibit extreme clarity and have an excellent soundstage dynamic. I mostly listen to jazz on vinyl and I think they are very versatile with my current setup. Headphones like speakers can only meet their maximum potential when pores with the proper components.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto G. Villanova

customer_reviews.title: I can say that they're really amazing. First
customer_reviews.text: After testing them for a few days, I can say that they're really amazing. First, you need to know that they arent neutral in therms of sound signature, they've their own unique tuning. I would call them a ''FUN'' headphones, because everything sounds more fun with these. They're really rich in bass, mids are extremely clear and crisp and highs are just fantastic. Separation in sound is phenomenal for semi-open headphones. You can hear all the instruments separated and it feels that there is free space between them. These are huge upgrade to P7. I own P5 wireless and I can say that this is night and day difference. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the audio quality is good - detailed
customer_reviews.text: I had the privilege of testing this for a few days. In short, the audio quality is good - detailed, fast transients, articulate, and good warmth. The only drawback from an audio perspective is the smallish soundstage. However, the single weakness is the uncomfortable clamping force and hard bads which hurt my jaw joint right below my ears. In chatting with a rep for Bowers, apparently I am not only the one complaining of this.
customer_reviews.author: Authentic

customer_reviews.title: No words.
customer_reviews.text: There is no point in trying to describe these with mere words. They are just that good. Well worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ql, so cheap for this ql
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Ql , so cheap for this ql .!! No Any Words ))
customer_reviews.author: Tim

product_meta.title: Bowers & Wilkins P9 Signature HiFi Over Ear Headphones, Wired, Italian Leather
product_meta.description:
Engineered by Masters of Sound. 

Optimised Cabinet. 
P9 Signature's elegant earcups contain sophisticated acoustic cabinets perfected using Finite Element Analysis. Using composites and aluminium this optimised acoustic environment enables the drive unit to do its job of rendering your music with total precision. 

De-coupled Headband. 
P9 Signature's headband cleverly decouples each earcup. This stops unwanted vibration transmitting between each earcup and the headband. This removal of distortion is one of the reasons P9 Signature is so clear and open sounding. 

Perfect Piston. 
Our engineers developed an advanced new drive unit for P9 Signature with a clever suspension system that enables it to provide precision at high frequencies and compliance for great bass. 

Features: 
Nylon damped cone with acoustic coating 
Large surround diaphragm 
CCAW coil with external large pole magnet 
Dual cavity ear cushions 
Changeable ear cushions 
Detachable cable 
Folding (hinged) design 

Inputs: 
3.5mm stereo jack (TRRS 4-pole CTIA spec.) 
3.5mm stereo jack (TRS 3-pole unbalanced stereo spec.) 

Drive units: 
2x 40mm (1.6in) full range 

Frequency range: 
2Hz to 30kHz 

Impedence: 
22 ohms 

Distortion (THD): 
<0.2% (1kHz/10mW) 

Sensitivity: 
111dB/V at 1kHz 

Max. input power: 
50mW 

Net weight: 
413g 

Apple compatibility: 
The remote and mic are supported by iPhone 3GS and later, iPod Touch 2nd generation and later, iPad all models. The remote is supported by iPod Classic all models, iPod Nano 4th generation and later, iPod Shuffle 3rd generation and later.
feature_bullets: The P9 Signature deliver pristine sound that takes you to the very heart of your favorite music. Crystal clear treble, insightful midrange and a deep solid bottom end combine breathtaking performance. Connectivity Technology: Wired

The P9 Signature headphones are exquisitely crafted from luxuriously high quality materials. Italian Saffiano leather and a forged foldable aluminum arms for greater durability and headband strength.3.5mm stereo jack (TRRS 4-pole CTIA spec.). Drive units-2x ø40mm (1.6in) full range
New proprietary piston diaphragm speaker drivers deliver a unique coloration-free audio experience. The angled drivers also bring a superior spatial sound stage for a unique and immersive experience.
Uniquely vented multi-layer memory foam cushions combine with the high-quality leather used on the ear-pads and headband to deliver an incredibly comfortable experience.

Bowers & Wilkins P9 Signature headphone comes with a 2-year limited warranty only when purchased from an authorized dealer including Amazon.com (indicated by ships from and sold by Amazon.com). Adjust the headband to a suitable size, ensuring that the ear cushions are centred over your ear canals
Frequency response - 2Hz to 30kHz and Impedance - 22 ohms
